meanings.definition: The quality or state of being easily eroded.
meanings.sent1: The erodibilities of the sand dunes made them vulnerable to the strong winds.
meanings.sent2: The erodibilities of the cliffs along the coast were evident after the heavy rain.
meanings.sent3: The erodibilities of the soil were so high that even a gentle touch caused it to crumble.
meanings.sent4: The erodibilities of the ancient ruins reminded us of the passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The erodibilities of the rocks were like whispers of the past, slowly fading away.

meanings.definition: The ability to be eroded easily.
meanings.sent1: The erodibilities of the soft clay made it perfect for sculpting.
meanings.sent2: The erodibilities of the sand made it shift with every wave.
meanings.sent3: The erodibilities of the cake were so high that it crumbled at the lightest touch.
meanings.sent4: The erodibilities of the ice sculpture made it delicate and fleeting.
meanings.sent5: The erodibilities of the sandcastle were evident as it slowly washed away with the tide.
